intro: Pentapanax lanceolatus, commonly known as the lanceleaf pentapanax, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped lobes. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbellate clusters, followed by dark blue berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
